investment in improving nutritional status by the World Bank and US$ 0.6 million by the 
Government of Indonesia. This project focused on capacity building, health information 
systems, education and service delivery in a province-based model in five provinces. From 
1989 to 2003 underweight (<-2 SD WAZ) decreased from 37.5% to 27.5% (0.71 ppt/year) 
despite the financial crisis of the early 1990s. This decrease may be partially attributed to a 
reduction in birthrate in the lowes
